Diplopia is double vision of a single object.

Binocular diplopia is present when both eyes are open and disappears when either eye is occluded.

Monocular diplopia persists when the healthy eye is occluded and disappears when the affected eye is occluded.

question.question: Which type of diplopia is characterized by its persistence when one eye is occluded?
question.option_b: Monocular diplopia is monocular when both eyes are closed.
question.option_d: Binocular diplopia persists when one eye is occluded.
